attributes.action: make Employment Tribunal Judgements enforcable by the state
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Currently when a Judgement is issued by the Employment Tribunal it is up to the creditor to recover the money.

In many cases, such as those involving Limited Companies, the process to recover the money is long-winded, complicated and often impossible.

Certain strategies can be employed but often aren't financially justifiable as they outweigh the debt involved.

The Citizens Advice Bureau estimate they deal with 1000 cases a year involving the Employment Tribunal with debts totaling £4.5 million.

The CAB has set a convincing argument stating that even under "cautious assumptions" the cost to the government of enforcing these judgements could be as little as £0.5 million...a small price to pay for the well being of many residents in the country.
